problem.markdown:
>>What does the z-score help us to identify? (1 attempts)<<
( ) A. The z-score is a measure that shows us the middle data point of our combined data (X) B. The z-score is a measure that supports us to identify suspicious values in our data ( ) C. The z-score is a measure that supports us in determining if a significant relationship exists between two or more variables
[explanation] Z-scores help us to identify suspicious values. Standard z-scores >= 3 are highly suspicious (or extreme), while modified z-scores >= 5 are highly suspicious (or extreme). Values with these z-scores will be shown when you apply z-score filters to your outlier data table. [explanation]

div.p: Z-scores help us to identify suspicious values. Standard z-scores >= 3 are highly suspicious (or extreme), while modified z-scores >= 5 are highly suspicious (or extreme). Values with these z-scores will be shown when you apply z-score filters to your outlier data table.
